title.#cdata-section: UNRWA claims: UN agency condemns aid halt over alleged help for Hamas attacks

description.#cdata-section: Nine countries pause funding for UNRWA over allegations its staff were involved in the 7 October attacks.

title.#cdata-section: Icon of the Seas: World's largest cruise ship sets sail from Miami

description.#cdata-section: The 20-deck Icon of the Seas' maiden voyage comes amid concerns about the vessel's methane emissions.

title.#cdata-section: Xavi: Barcelona manager to leave at end of season

description.#cdata-section: Barcelona manager Xavi says "the club needs a change of dynamic" and will step down at the end of the season.

title.#cdata-section: North Korea fires cruise missiles off east coast, Seoul reports

description.#cdata-section: The missile launch follows months of weapons testing by communist North Korea, raising tensions.

title.#cdata-section: Houthis attack British-linked tanker Marlin Luanda in Gulf of Aden

title.#cdata-section: Beauty giant Avon under fire over Russia links

description.#cdata-section: The firm is facing criticism for continuing production and recruiting new sales agents in Russia.

title.#cdata-section: Huge push for Gaza aid - but little hope for those suffering

description.#cdata-section: There's a chasm between what Gaza needs and what it's receiving, writes Quentin Sommerville.

title.#cdata-section: Defamation defeat a double-edged sword for Trump

description.#cdata-section: An $83m bill is a message to Mr Trump to stop defaming his rape accuser, experts say. But will it work?

title.#cdata-section: Germany: Scholz warns against rise of neo-Nazi networks

description.#cdata-section: To mark Holocaust Memorial Day, the German chancellor voices concern about "neo-Nazis and their dark networks".

title.#cdata-section: Kenya femicide: Hundreds protest at violence against women

title.#cdata-section: US convicts Russian man who flew to LA without passport

title.#cdata-section: Taylor Swift deepfakes spark calls in Congress for new legislation

description.#cdata-section: President Biden's statement came as he pushed US lawmakers to pass bipartisan border security bill.

title.#cdata-section: ICJ says Israel must prevent genocide in Gaza

description.#cdata-section: But it stops short of ordering Israel to halt the war in Gaza, in a controversial case at The Hague.

description.#cdata-section: Israeli protesters stop a convoy of humanitarian aid trucks entering Gaza for third consecutive day.

title.#cdata-section: Mediators push for Gaza ceasefire deal but gaps remain between Israel and Hamas

description.#cdata-section: Indirect talks have brought no breakthrough, but neither Israel nor Hamas have abandoned them.

title.#cdata-section: Khan Younis: UN says 12 killed at Gaza shelter as fighting rages

description.#cdata-section: A UN agency says shells hit a college in Khan Younis, but Israel rules out a strike by its forces.

description.#cdata-section: Fighting is reported around hospitals in the city, where Israel believes Hamas leaders are hiding.

title.#cdata-section: Israel-Gaza war: IDF says 24 soldiers killed in Gaza in one day

description.#cdata-section: Monday was the deadliest day for Israel since the start of its ground operation.

title.#cdata-section: 'I go to sleep a dead man' - father's pain at daughter's captivity in Gaza

description.#cdata-section: Eli Albag is haunted by the ordeal of his daughter Liri, held hostage in Gaza, as he campaigns for more pressure on Qatar.

title.#cdata-section: ICJ orders Israel to take all measures to prevent genocidal acts

description.#cdata-section: The UN's top court's ruling stopped short of ordering Israel to immediately halt its operations in Gaza.
